data.title: Beer and food
data.text: Had home made beer was lovely and very tasty food was good service excellent and the back drop from the windows of the mountain xx

data.title: Relaxing. Great craft beers.
data.text: Nice place to kick back, relax and enjoy some craft beer. Maybe meet some new friends. Staff very knowledgeable on their beers. Many different events. Follow them on Facebook to keep up with events and beer selections.

data.title: Good beer, but avoid the music nights if you want to hear
data.text:
We walked in and were pleasantly surprised because the live music was just getting ready to go on. Their beer is quite tasty, but the band said "you guys like it loud, right?" to which I shrugged. 

My two buddies and I had to converse via text as we finished our beers quickly as to save our ears. 

On the bright side, the volume in the bathroom, way at the back of the store, was perfect, and you could almost make out the lyrics. 

Basically it wasn't exactly our scene

data.title: Relaxing Atmosphere
data.text: Went in here on a cold Saturday afternoon, and immediately felt warm and welcomed!  Sat down and was handed a menu with beer descriptions.  Ordered a beer, pretzels and cheese and had great conversation with the bartender and other customers.  Would definitely go back.

data.title: Not bad for K-town but I don't think it would hold up to any competition in any similarly sized city.
data.text: For crafter brew pubs in general this would rank low, but overall it is in Kenosha.  It's a chill place where you can hang out and have some decent brews. I will say I had a Porter that was off. It had a strong butter microwave popcorn thing going on(Diacetyl).  I returned it full but was not offered anything else or even really acknowledged other than "didn't like it huh". You can see some of the work space where they brew and the time I was there it was a mess. The front and bar area is kind of slapped together looking. Armature-hour -ish. I guess though  it is actually an armature operation and must have been quite a low budget start up. Overall, not bad.  Beer is okay.  No food. Not bad for K-town but I don't think it would hold up to any competition in any similarly sized city.

data.title: YUM
data.text: So many choices of fabulous brews. You can always find something no matter what your favorite style of beer. I love the atmosphere- books, games, conversational seating, great staff. Reminds me of a wonderful coffee shop but with beer!

data.title: First visit to Public Craft
data.text: Really liked the atmosphere and the variety of custom crafted beers.    Met the brewmaster who was very knowledgable.

data.title: Friendly microbrewery with great beer!
data.text: This is a fun, quirky place.  The atmosphere is inviting and family friendly.  There are books and board games available for use, making this a comfortable place to hang out and enjoy some beer on a chilly winter day.  The beer is brewed on site, with the brewing process viewable in the back, and the resulting smells are amazing!  They should sell a Public Craft candle!  Bartenders are enthusiastic about the beers and are generous with samples and recommendations.

data.title: Welcome place to hang with friends or if your by yourself seem friends just show up
data.text: Great social hangout. People are chill and the beer expands your horizons.no food but all are welcome to order in or bring your own apps. Seems like dogs are welcome. We like to meet friends and it seems that many more pop in and share good times. This is a fine addition to our town.

data.title: Nice Beer Variety. Root Beer Too!
data.text: Nice place to have a beer or too.  I've enjoyed my experience here.  Will visit again in the future.  You should too.

data.title: Great beer, excellent atmosphere
data.text: My husband and I love to go to Public!  My favorite beer there at the moment is the Hot Chocolate Stout, made with chocolate and peppers.  I especially like that Public doesn't have tv's so we get to talk to each other and whoever happens to be sitting near us.  The owner and bartenders are very nice, too, and keep our glasses full.  There's no food for sale besides pretzels with cheese and landjaegers (like beef jerky), but you can order in any food you want.

data.title: Warm welcome, comfy space and tasty brews
data.text: Stopped in here yesterday about 25 minutes before closing after a 75 mile bike ride up from Chicago. Atmosphere was great: lots of space to hand out, play games and chat. Good variety of beers on tap, and friendly staff that let us stay and have a second beer while we waited for the train back to the city. Minimal snacks available but I spied a stack of delivery menus behind the bar.

data.title: Great local beer!
data.text: I have only been here once, but knowing the owners and knowing how much work they have put into this place makes me really appreciate this business! The beers here are phenomenal and they are featured in more bars than just Public Craft. I love seeing a local business thrive.

data.title: Great Service • Good Beer
data.text: First, the staff was just awesome here.  Couldn't have been more appropriately-interactive and entertaining.  As for the beer, it was generally OK.  My favorites were Public Access IPA (session), Public Pale Ale, and Hop-In-The-Sack IPA.  It was such a fun place—I think if I were in K-Town again that I'd stop by and see if they had anything new on tap.

data.title: Friendly staff in a comfortable and inviting tasting room
data.text:
We stopped here to do a tasting on a Sat afternoon and we had a great time.

The place is laid out nice with comfortable furniture and really cool artwork on the walls. It makes for a nice relaxing afternoon to enjoy a flight of beers. 

The woman that helped us was friendly and knowledgeable about all of their beers. As for the beer, we enjoyed them all. Rarely will we find a microbrewery where we like all of their beer styles but all of their beers were good. We ended up bringing home a growler of their Belgian Wit.

Looking forward to our next visit to get our growler refilled.
